sen.j: 丹後大宮駅（たんごおおみやえき）は、京都府京丹後市大宮町 (京都府)口大野にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kuchiono, Omiya-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tango-Omiya Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Tango-Omiya Station, located in Kuchiono, Omiya-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Tango-Omiya Station, located in Kuchiono, Omiya-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ駅である。
sen.e: The station has two separate platforms serving two tracks.
The station has two separate platforms serving two tracks.
The station has two separate platforms serving two tracks.

sen.j: 駅舎は、平安朝風の建物を模している。
sen.e: The station building was made to imitate the Heian-style architecture.
The station building was designed to emulate the architecture of the Heian period.
The station building was designed to emulate the architecture of the Heian period.

sen.j: 当駅も一時期交換設備が撤去されていたが、KTR転換時に復活している。
sen.e: The pass-by facility was removed from the station for a period of time, but the facility was recovered when the station was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
The bypass facility was removed from the station for a period of time, but it was recovered when the station was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway.

A facility, where inbound and outbound trains could pass one another, was removed from the station for a period of time, but it was recovered when the station was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: 交換設備→A facility, where inbound and outbound trains could pass one another としました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: Kyoto Bank, Kuchiono Branch
Kyoto Bank, Kuchiono Branch

sen.j: 国民健康保険センター 丹後おおみや
sen.e: National Health Insurance Center Tango Omiya
National Health Insurance Center Tango Omiya

sen.j: 「丹後の特産品アンテナショップ あるでえ丹後」
sen.e: Arude Tango - Antenna Shop for Products of Tango'
Arude Tango - Antenna Shop for Products of Tango'
Arude Tango - Antenna Shop for Products of Tango'

sen.j: 丹後の特産品を扱う店で、食事処「あるでえ 食事処（どころ）」も併設されている。
sen.e: A shop that sells products of Tango, which also has a restaurant 'Arude restaurant.'
The shop, which sells products of Tango, also contains the 'Arude' restaurant.
The shop, which sells products of Tango, also contains the 'Arude' restaurant.
Use of the station
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約115人である。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day in 2006 was about 115.
The average daily number of passengers in 2006 was 115.
The average daily number of passengers in fiscal year 2006 was 115.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。

sen.e: (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）11月3日 日本国有鉄道峰山線（のちに宮津線）延長と同時に開業（開業当時は口大野駅だった。）。
sen.e: On November 3, 1925 the station was opened when the Mineyama Line (later Miyazu Line) operated by the Japanese National Railways was extended (the station was called Kuchiono Station when it was opened).

On November 3, 1925, the station was opened when the Mineyama Line (later the Miyazu Line), operated by the Japanese National Railways, was extended (initially the station was called Kuchiono Station).
November 3, 1925: The station was opened when the Mineyama Line (later the Miyazu Line), operated by the Japan National Railways, was extended (initially the station was called Kuchiono Station).
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に変更しました。

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1987 the station came to be owned by the JR West by the division and privatization of the Japan National Railways.
On April 1, 1987, the station came to be owned by the JR West due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station came to be owned by the JR West due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に変更しました。

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日 北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1990 the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway, thereby the station came to be owned by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
On April 1, 1990, the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway, whereby the station came under the ownership of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway, whereby the station came under the ownership of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に変更しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
